instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U5000: What is U5000? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in macbooks from 2013-2015.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS? This power rail is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H & the input of PPBUS_G3H to circuitry that provides power for the CPU..
definitions.PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC: What is PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC? PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC Is a reference voltage for the SMCâ€™s voltage sensors & other sensors..
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.C7125: What is C7125? Capacitor between CHGR_BOOT and CHGR_PHASE important for bootstrapping creation of PPBUS_G3H on 2013-2015 macbook pros.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not powering on. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> only 3.28v
threads.message:
Hi again.
I have Macbook Air that came in reported not turning on.
Gets a green/orange Magsafe LED but no fan spin or other sign of life.
Tested with known good charger - same.

Very slight water ingress - literally a few dots only on the top side of board.
A few tiny signs of corrosion near:
<CAPACITOR>C5514</CAPACITOR> (just above <CHIP>U5000</CHIP>, but no signs of corrosion on, near <CHIP>U5000</CHIP> at all).
<CAPACITOR>C2971</CAPACITOR>,
<RESISTOR>R8154</RESISTOR>.

Cleaned.

Noticed <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> was getting too hot to touch.
Replaced and no longer getting hot.

ALSO, <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> MEASURES 0v.
However <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> is 3.3v

Other voltages:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.28v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> = 3.28v
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> = 15.14
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.42
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> = 3.21

Thanks for any help you can provide.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not powering on. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> only 3.28v
threads.message:
Post <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> voltages; pins 1, 2, 3, 6, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.
Replace <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR>, just in case.
Check all solders and traces around <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.
Also post exact resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28.
